html.p: This app makes the following custom commands available:

Use: Creates a graph on the Neo4j instance by transforming the input events, transforming and sending them to the graph db. Takes a set of multiple fields as input to create the nodes and relationsships as a graph.

ul.p: Description: Cypher command with which the nodes and/or relationsships are being created. Choose between "merge" and "create".

Description: Selector for the properties fields. Choose which fields are taken/read from the inputfield by prepending their names with this prefix. This prefix is then removed from the fieldname in the graph.

html.p: Use: Creates a graph on the Neo4j instance by transforming the input events, transforming and sending them to the graph db. Takes a set of json objects as input to create the nodes and relationsships as a graph. The json object needs to come with all needed fields.

ul.p: Description: Cypher command with which the nodes and/or relationsships are being created. Choose between "merge" and "create".
Description: Name of the field which is taken as inputfield.

Description: Selector for the properties fields. Choose which fields are taken/read from the inputfield by prepending their names with this prefix. This prefix is then removed from the fieldname in the graph.

html.p: | cypher uri=<my_uri_id> account=<my_account_id> noact=<true|false> mode=<read|write> query=<"cypher_querysstring">
Use: Runs a user specified command on the Neo4j instance.

ul.p: Description: Mode for the cypher transaction and command, if it intends to make changes. Choose between "read" and "write".
Description: Cypher querystring to be executed on the graph db.

html.p: Use: Pulls all nodes and relationships from the graph db.
Further info: This command supports multiple labels.

html.h1: Common Options available on all commands

ul.p: Description: URI_ID: ID of the Neo4j URI entry as specified in configuration page under "Neo4j URI".
Description: Account_ID: ID of the Neo4j Account entry as specified in configuration page under "Neo4j Accounts".
Description: No action. Easy flag to temporarily disable the custom command.

ul.li: Please note the difference in meaning between node_ref and node_id. The former is the required field for referencing nodes in the input dataset when creating graphs. It has no other function as uniquely referencing nodes in the building the cypher commands that create the graph. It is not persistent and vanishes after the graph was created. The latter is returned by graph queries: It is the ID neo4j assigns to stored nodes and rels.

Variables like node_ref are fed to Neo4j and need to follow Neo4j conventions. node_ref is a name type in cypher and therefore needs to start with an alphabetic char. See Cypher naming conventions for more info.
These fields need to be present for creating nodes: obj_type="node", node_ref, node_label. Props are optional.
These fields need to be present for creating rels: obj_type="rel", rel_type, rel_dst_node [as in node_ref], rel_src_node [as in node_ref]. Props are optional.
Ensure that nodes are created before rels (by sorting nodes to the top). The creategraph commands only succeed if the rel_src_node and rel_dst_node are already present on rel creation.
Please be aware that graph objects only allow storing of non-fancy data types. See Cypher Values and types for more info.
Speed of the commands are not in focus yet. Expect creation of larger graphs to take a while. You may want to adjust the timeout in commands.conf.
